article:
A 'micrometre' or 'micrometer' (, symbol 'Âµm') is an SI derived unit of length
equaling 1Ã10 â6 of a metre (SI standard prefix "micro-" =
10 â6 ); that is, one-millionth of a metre (or one-thousandth of a
millimetre, 0.001 mm, or about 0.000039 inches). The symbol Âµm is sometimes
rendered as 'um' if the symbol Âµ cannot be used.

The micrometre is a common unit of measurement for wavelengths of infrared
radiation as well as sizes of cells and
bacteria. [http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/380452/micrometre
"micrometre"] EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica Online, accessed 17 March 2012

The symbol for the SI prefix micro-, Âµ, is a Greek lowercase mu, Î¼. In Unicode,
it has a codepoint distinct from that of the Greek letter lowercase mu so that
it can be recognized as a symbol and not a letter. Many fonts use the same glyph
for the two characters.
